definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to rub oneself down with a wet towel/to take a sponge bath
to bathe/to immerse oneself in a warm bath
to wash the dirt to find a defect (idiom); to find fault/to nitpick
communal bath/common pool in bath house
tub (used for ablutions in a monastery)
to bathe the body and cleanse virtue (idiom); to improve oneself by meditation/cleanliness is next to godliness

sentences.english: It's very hot, sa the horseman decides to give the horses a bath.
sentences.chinese: 天气非常热，所以养马人决定给马儿们洗个澡。

sentences.english: Doris:I think because I turned on the air conditioner right after showering and before I blow-dried my hair.
sentences.chinese: 大概是我刚刚洗完澡没吹头发又立刻开冷气的关系吧。

sentences.english: Will there be enough time for a bath?
You can be showered and ready to go in 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 男人只要花10分钟就能洗完澡，整装待发。

sentences.english: In the locker room I pull off my clothes and take a one-minute shower.
sentences.chinese: 我在更衣室脱下了衣服，冲了一分钟澡。

sentences.english: Out of the shower now, I finish the last of the beer while trimming my toenails.
sentences.chinese: 洗完澡，我剪着趾甲喝完最后一口啤酒。

sentences.english: It is illegal to go to bed without first having a full bath.
sentences.chinese: 未先洗全身澡就上床睡觉是违法的。

sentences.english: A bath in the hot spring , a film in the cinema , finished the day quickly .
sentences.chinese: 在温泉里泡个澡，去影院看场电影，一天很快过去了。

sentences.english: If you're not near the coast or a lake, try taking a bath.
sentences.chinese: 如果你离海岸或者湖泊很远的话，那就洗个澡吧。

sentences.english: When day broke he flew down to the river and had a bath.
sentences.chinese: 黎明时分他飞下河去洗了个澡。

sentences.english: He took a shower after playing tennis.
sentences.chinese: 他打完网球后冲了个澡。

sentences.english: Take a shower under a waterfall.
This site used to be the private baths for Yang Guifei, favorite concubine of the Tang emperor.
sentences.chinese: 您还可以到杨贵妃洗澡的华清池去洗温泉澡。

sentences.english: We could just take a shower right here. There's nobody but us.
sentences.chinese: 我们待会儿只要冲个澡，这里又没别人。

sentences.english: Too very, entire body perspiration, washed a Zao.
sentences.chinese: 太极，出了一身汗，洗了个澡。

definition: taking a bath together as a couple
to bathe/to immerse oneself in a warm bath
to wash the face and rinse the mouth
to make oneself presentable/to freshen up
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions
